document.title: Early Childhood Standards of Quality for Birth to Kindergarten

CD9A2AC0EDAA4B108D848B6109B5566C.description: With modeling and support, remember that they should not share any personal information (name, age, address, phone number) online.

A7EA655E3E9848B4819038FD0BE317DE.description:
With modeling and support, use the share feature of a photo app to upload a
photo of their block tower to an archive managed by a familiar adult.

9E58955614394F2BAAED549D8F3BCCDF.description:
With guidance, remember to only open a web browser or internet-connected
software when an adult is supervising.

9B52B3AA377F404A9F2D1293AD737BAB.description:
With guidance and supervision, use only those websites listed in a web
browser’s bookmarks.

8E20DFEA7CDA44CB927615084E1F1FCC.description: Use a tablet to take pictures of themselves making different faces.

2D9376454AF3458EBD8559AC8B75F2E1.description:
Make suggestions about how to use the internet safely when the group is
deciding on expectations for their use.

4776A51CE87849948E40513F4938B544.description: Share pictures by showing the device to other children.

17C7C704BC874BEBA3B72A4D931E141B.description: Use only provided apps and digital resources on their device.

0804A920D1594AB3A955CDE7EEB47897.description:
Ask questions and engage in a conversation about how to use the internet
safely when the group is making a list of expectations.

4C0E6C8FA04A4826B30A77CE4BB3ED10.description: With adult guidance and supervision, begins to demonstrate an understanding of internet safety

04EF821F850C49678F1F3012840B0434.description:
With guidance and support, explain that a photo on the internet belongs to
the person who took the picture.

263CF16F2B374C3CA691217CD54698D6.description:
With support, use different apps on a device to take a series of photos of a
plant, and then include those photos in a slideshow of the plant’s growth.

ACEC9D24A4614083875F3325156586EF.description: With modeling and guidance, use a mouse to navigate a computer screen.

9DB2D635D2964C4F82CD53474CFD0FA6.description:
Make suggestions about how to use digital tools responsibly when the group
is deciding on expectations for their use.

A07BDDA6C8574A27B62071FF8DF280A4.description:
When reminded, and with modeling and guidance, plug a tablet into its
charger when they see a low battery warning.

0D948E578B604F228741079B7F4BA568.description:
With modeling and guidance, carry a device carefully around the room to
take photos.

5BF74327E83F47658B759A47FFBB9C06.description:
Ask questions and engage in a conversation about how to use digital tools
responsibly when the group is making a list of expectations.

7726B4FCD500444BA08FC728CEBF0648.description:
With modeling and practice, return a device to an adult when they see a low
battery warning.

CFABA4F48A5F4F6189987B3936258040.description: When reminded, shut down a device when they are finished using it.

D06E1359B4114AD1BA057001004DCCCF.description:
With modeling and guidance, turn a device on and off, and navigate to
favorite apps.

AB710C80DB0647FFB2B55D2DF1C13BC7.description:
When reminded, leave their food or drink on a table away from the device
they’re using.

08E24D10EFDD4F6C9E8F6438F7412C42.description:
Engage in a large group activity to make a short list of what is expected
when they are using digital tools in the learning environment.

95DF334B4CEC4BBA976F3F1266FA86C0.description: With adult support and supervision, uses digital tools and resources responsibly.

CC30C68B7D4345488818EB16EE659337.description: Children begin to use digital tools and resources responsibly.

CBC6DA9B1BED450D9D5FEDAEC800DE5B.description:
Use an encyclopedia app to answer their questions about where
penguins live.

4C968EAFA95F4604AB150B21EC9EA0E6.description: Record their measurement of the rain in their science journal.

5AD6F327952D4CC090EDB83135BA19BE.description:
Follow along with a simple YouTube Kids video as it demonstrates
how to draw a cat.

454799362FA54DB39675874A87B105CB.description: Show others a video they made of themselves dancing.

2442D6161262477DA197EDB08AD9A58B.description: Draw pictures of their bicycle with more and more detail.

3E0C3A915668406D8A7BC80EA5FCCF7E.description: Tell about something they learned from a video clip about penguins.

41319A4B00E444A3842C36AEA6B2B284.description: Use a tablet to take pictures of themselves making different faces.

8D6E2277630E4C9ABDE1C7DD5F6DB66A.description: Use adaptive devices for support when telling peers about themselves.

C40E910195A54EF09A1782BE3752B976.description: Show a familiar adult how they used scoops and funnels in the sensory table.

73F2C3E59F3A4631A41D2B7F48463A7B.description: Draw a picture of one of the characters from a favorite game.

6DD591CB31354F1CB7F2CF05C982708D.description: Describe a game they play on a family member’s phone at home.

630BE8CF471041989C6BFE410E2D89BB.description: Communicates about their experiences with (digital or non-digital) tools and resources.

F87DE606FBD34F1ABA2CF0701037D495.description: Use a cup, compass, or stencil to draw a circle.

8B498235D17F4F95AA054AE4B1298B6F.description:
With adult supervision, look up dinosaurs in an encyclopedia app to find out
what color dinosaurs were.

26AB0141BBF7486DBAE6CF5E9989BD7E.description:
Look through a book about birds to find out how many different colors a
parakeet can be.

73123C7D237849B2A3F831DB3FB9BC72.description:
With adult support, use non-standard measuring tools, such as blocks or
carpet squares, to figure out how long something is.

1EAF349B55C3497C8B9223D54A876414.description:
With adult support and supervision, use a computer to look up instructions
for how to plant seeds.

6AA10F2ECF4C40D983E6AEE477E9DA65.description: Look at a picture of a block tower as an example of what they can build.

CC26369634E84004A8B22A6E7C737FD7.description:
With adult support and supervision, use a tablet to look for pictures of a
plant’s life cycle.

1E36E970A9234BF89E0F217D35BD7F47.description:
With adult support and supervision, explores (digital or non-digital) tools and resources to find
information.

101916A74ECC4A3A9A07D9AE4BB18FC4.description: Children explore and interact with (digital or non-digital) tools and resources.

79D0BBAD7EFE4AC6AB9EA5ED5D6E91C3.description: Plan and build a complex block construction with other children.

DB4896A069714A80BDB1142F8505609E.description: Work as a group to draw a map on a tablet or chart paper.

13A49B0D1A314251AEB219B2DDCF6FB9.description: Take turns using a tablet with another child.

AFFD5625FC5940E78548C53CB789CEC9.description:
Use glue sticks, scissors, and paintbrushes to create a mural with other
children.

C7945557A5E44C08BC9FA81CF2537DAE.description:
Work with other children to use a tablet to collect data on their peers’ favorite
fruit.

B16168446DB142C9B1B8C5A19F62B825.description: Use a computer next to another child.

8B988F64C6134712ADADFCDBC28D2C08.description: Work with other children to take pictures for a collage.

4B03900132F8459EBCA5CE5AF0E67649.description: Uses tools to work with others.

FD91000F33C04BF09E3FB07D2CB57924.description:
Use a translation or interpreter app to help them communicate with a friend
whose home language is not the same as their own.

AA518B42810345B1B9464870EFFD059F.description:
Play a “coding” game using arrow cards to “program” another child’s
movements.

EE2BBBB924F047E085F6C400BECDB7ED.description: Join in with others of differing abilities in solving a puzzle or maze.

80C8B5939F8E4C8881B3C8EC6EDC12B5.description: Use adaptive devices to operate software on the computer.

E5DFF330FED544E9B3CB9BB1B184C7BB.description: Use a tablet to take pictures of themselves making different faces.

3243741405354E079ED835431B39B20D.description: Use a mirror to watch themselves make happy and sad faces.

2470D3BF69294DF6BBDCB4E7B3CEAC86.description: Explores tools for the purpose of communication or self-expression.

C3C085CF3FC44BF6AF8462B4C1138B9D.description:
Children use tools (digital or non-digital) to communicate and
collaborate with others.

241360A8790343FCAD71EEE75A4F07CF.description:
Ask a familiar adult to look up the directions for a card game they want to
play.

7BB4E0C86013400AAFCCDEBFB494D076.description: Think of and test several ways to build a sturdy ramp for their toy cars.

6B680BC78DCA4D4ABB6030A7BDC91E91.description: Ask a familiar adult to plug in a tablet that won’t turn on.

8005D8B7A3984E2C9253C61DDD28BA2B.description:
Walk around the room touching a magnet to different things to find out what
will stick to it.

CECD15CE7F5845049A1D65317D75FF7B.description:
With adult support, look through the basket of playdough tools to find
something that will cut playdough.

256AA835FDEF47DEB7786B993E2D42F6.description:
Recognizes real-world problems in their environment and begins to experiment with tools and other
strategies to solve those problems.

B62D20006677485AB272BD5B74ED2760.description: Experiment to discover what a magnet will stick to.

96D371B88CE040889EB6E6466E61A7EB.description:
Learn how to play Red Light, Green Light and explain the rules to another
child.

284ECF5297484FB7AD111CA135E466B1.description: Stop pouring milk into their cup before it’s full or overflows.

C2D51DAA0F8A449CBFA5DDEEBD050B4B.description: Add water to sand to make it moldable without turning into mud.

FF0CEDB2F54843559A091911213A07A3.description:
Bounce balls on the sidewalk with more and more force, to get them to
bounce higher.

755A3FF524FA40099393ADBECB91053F.description:
Carry their toy cars to the hard floor or table to play “because they go faster”
than when they’re on the carpet.

1090F2B1EADE4AC39EE14B977AB96DA9.description: Learns from their experiments and experiences.

C8E73CAA855A4E9DAA5E67E7583461B2.description: Use an eyedropper to move liquid from one container to another.

E3C3BC28CB954E8C8BC5984F630B43E0.description: Use a stencil, straight-edge ruler, and/or compass to draw shapes on paper.

7C53EE0C791E47B5852BC428655AC2E1.description:
Use scrap supplies and paper to engineer an imaginary city. With adult
supervision, identify a website of their choosing from the options bookmarked in
the web browser.

4BAA90A19A1A466F8FDE6174BE0D6C62.description: Use a tablet to watch a video of how crayons are made.

CE5D61A09AD840CDA8FDDA04DD195F70.description: Use a tablet and stylus to “sign in” when they enter the learning environment.

AFBA35D9F18F4F0798D565032B0683FF.description:
Use a tablet, or clipboard and paper, to record other children’s responses to a
survey of their favorite colors, then use blocks or paper and markers to create a
graph to show the most common favorites.

D098BE220025494694235FECAE111A4F.description: Use a small garden trowel to dig holes for planting seeds.

C4CEA4C5164F4E8593130882C8BF8636.description:
Use a screwdriver to drive large, flat-tipped machine screws in and out of a
block of wood, using their fingers to twist and untwist a bolt on the other side of
the screw.

97124AAF5D544271A21AD8C74298AC8C.description: With adult supervision, choose a game from the PBS Kids website using visual cues.

241530261F0B48DCA2D136FEBC44E452.description:
Use a stylus to navigate an interactive technology device and find out how tall a
T. Rex was.

0A4881B9D1534ABF9855F4D880ADD2B6.description:
Make walls, tunnels, and towers for their castle construction with paper towel
tubes and cardboard boxes.

DD5EA225E66A40EFBA9FD56ADF649B96.description:
Use an empty cereal box to support an unsteady “balcony” area of the castle
they are building.

AA2ED46FD4044A889A1263F1C16F1994.description:
Work with a group to build a tunnel out of shipping boxes that is large enough to
crawl through.

20DB1C32160B40EC8D5DA50F4E95081A.description:
Record the behaviors of a classroom pet on a tablet, on chart paper, or in a
science journal.

F06BE5AB14DD40C1BCF4AB008E3B5089.description: Use a scoop to move water or sand from the sensory table into a container.

79AC2E39E96442EABD85FBA622BC828E.description: Use a small mallet or hammer to pound golf tees into a Styrofoam block.

8B475DBCC2354DB487E2D26813AC5687.description:
With adult supervision, click on a specific, favorite game app on a tablet in the
learning environment.

40124ED2BDBC46CE94BC319D700E8BF8.description: Use wooden blocks to build a road for the animal toys to follow.

341D33F39FBD4E5DB1364FB765F12487.description: Use wood blocks to make a ramp for cars.

9D761DF1D65B4DAEB6172BD06A2503D2.description: Use a large appliance box as a space for dramatic play.

B191FC75740A4383BE568117AD9CEE49.description: Use a triangular block as a ramp for a small car.

5D366B360F444D5DBB786E6549991D37.description: Use a sand timer to know how long their turn is on a computer.

2EB5D6DA83F44A5784870161258BD018.description: Use a camera to take a picture of their block tower.

67555D06AE3645789E7098F52112239D.description: Explore and experiment with different uses for the tools, objects, and materials in their environment.

B57A244A57EB4AC1AC9D25D3F67E3BEA.description:
Children use tools (digital or non-digital) to learn, create,
accomplish tasks, and solve problems.
